title.narrative: 04.3 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SERVICES IN UNDERSERVED AREAS

description.narrative: Extension:2015-16: Output 04.3: By 2016, 500,000 women, children and other population in underserved areas in 50 ris and 20 Ups (county Towns) equitably and sustainably use safe drinking water sources, improved sanitation facilities and practice hand washing with soap 2014-15 Output 04.2 By 2015, 500,000 more women, children and other population in underserved areas in 50 ris and 20 Ups (County Town) equitably and sustainably use safe drinking water sources, improved sanitation facilities and practice hand washing with soap (FA1, OT -12)2011-13 Intermediate Results (IR) 06.1: Strengthen National and local Government capacity to "scale up access to, delivery and utilization of water and sanitation and hygiene education services" for children and women promoting equity and sustainability. ( FA1,OT-12), which contributes to Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2015-16 Outcome 04: By 2016, National and local governments implement relevant and effective Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) policies and strategies that equitably increase access to, and use of quality Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services.2014-15 Outcome 04: By 2015, National and local governments implement relevant and effective Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) policies and strategies that equitably increase access to quality Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services 2011-13 PCR 6: By 2015, capacity of national and local Government strengthened to increase access and delivery and utilization of quality water and sanitation services for children and women.

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Water supply - peri-urban and urban communities service delivery
Water supply - rural communities service delivery

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: More than 120,000 people were provided with access to safe drinking water; 31,803 through installation of piped water systems and 91,200 through provision of water purification tablets as an immediate response to emergency. | Status:Met | As-of Date:09/01/2017
